text:
I have 2 questions:
1) Is it possible to autocomplete an input based on data from HubDB (e.g. display address has a full line address. As the user starts typing in "Switzer..." it would start showing the Switzerland addresses)
2) Is it possible to query HubDB based on user input without reposting the page? In theory, I have already obtained the dataset can I filter it "on the fly" so the page doesn't have to go through a post?

Yes to both questions. Thereâ€™s a few ways you can do it. All of them require you to use javascript to check against the form input.

Totally depends on how you want to do it but you could store the data you need from HubDB in a script tag that creates an object on the page, you can query against.

OR you can use the javascript API clients, which make it easier to work with the hubdb apis <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vTuu12oFF4bQY1zVD2-WKFuM2dEDN81-fZRV1tGaCL5Z_OcjC-B6O3mHXR6chaq25BU1D2FuvKIjc49/pub>
Hi all- i'm trying to use hubl code to join 2 tables, however the foreign row part isn't rendering.
should I be setting the foreign table id as a variable in the first place?

hey <@UMGLMQLA0>,
i want this type of result, and i used the two table one for location and on for events

may be this help you
